        public static MPI hash(int version,
       MPI a,
       MPI b,
       Provider prov)
                throws OTRException
        Hash one or two MPIs. To hash only one MPI, b may be set to NULL.
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • serializeMPIArray

        public static byte[] serializeMPIArray(MPI[] mpis)
                                throws OTRException
        This method accepts an array of MPIs, and returns a byte array containing a reversible serialization.
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • unserializeMPIArray

        public static MPI[] unserializeMPIArray(byte[] buffer)
                                 throws OTRException
        Takes a byte array containing serialized and concatenated MPIs and converts it to an array of MPIs. The buffer is assumed to consist of a 4-byte int containing the number of MPIs in the array, followed by {size, data} pairs for each MPI.
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • checkKnowLog

        public static int checkKnowLog(MPI c,
               MPI d,
               MPI g,
               MPI x,
               int version,
               Provider prov)
                        throws OTRException
        Verify a proof of knowledge of a discrete logarithm. Checks that c = h(g^d x^c)
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • step1

        public static byte[] step1(ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.SMState astate,
           byte[] secret,
           Provider prov)
                    throws OTRException
        Create first message in SMP exchange. Input is Alice's secret value which this protocol aims to compare to Bob's. The return value is a serialized MPI array whose elements correspond to the following: [0] = g2a, Alice's half of DH exchange to determine g2 [1] = c2, [2] = d2, Alice's ZK proof of knowledge of g2a exponent [3] = g3a, Alice's half of DH exchange to determine g3 [4] = c3, [5] = d3, Alice's ZK proof of knowledge of g3a exponent
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • step2a

        public static void step2a(ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.SMState bstate,
          byte[] input,
          int received_question,
          Provider prov)
                   throws OTRException
        Receive the first message in SMP exchange, which was generated by step1. Input is saved until the user inputs their secret information. No output.
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • step2b

        public static byte[] step2b(ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.SMState bstate,
            byte[] secret,
            Provider prov)
                     throws OTRException
        Create second message in SMP exchange. Input is Bob's secret value. Information from earlier steps in the exchange is taken from Bob's state. Output is a serialized mpi array whose elements correspond to the following: [0] = g2b, Bob's half of DH exchange to determine g2 [1] = c2, [2] = d2, Bob's ZK proof of knowledge of g2b exponent [3] = g3b, Bob's half of DH exchange to determine g3 [4] = c3, [5] = d3, Bob's ZK proof of knowledge of g3b exponent [6] = pb, [7] = qb, Bob's halves of the (Pa/Pb) and (Qa/Qb) values [8] = cp, [9] = d5, [10] = d6, Bob's ZK proof that pb, qb formed correctly
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • step3

        public static byte[] step3(ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.SMState astate,
           byte[] input,
           Provider prov)
                    throws OTRException
        Create third message in SMP exchange. Input is a message generated by otrl_sm_step2b. Output is a serialized mpi array whose elements correspond to the following: [0] = pa, [1] = qa, Alice's halves of the (Pa/Pb) and (Qa/Qb) values [2] = cp, [3] = d5, [4] = d6, Alice's ZK proof that pa, qa formed correctly [5] = ra, calculated as (Qa/Qb)^x3 where x3 is the exponent used in g3a [6] = cr, [7] = d7, Alice's ZK proof that ra is formed correctly
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • step4

        public static byte[] step4(ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.SMState bstate,
           byte[] input,
           Provider prov)
                    throws OTRException
        Create final message in SMP exchange. Input is a message generated by otrl_sm_step3. Output is a serialized mpi array whose elements correspond to the following: [0] = rb, calculated as (Qa/Qb)^x3 where x3 is the exponent used in g3b [1] = cr, [2] = d7, Bob's ZK proof that rb is formed correctly This method also checks if Alice and Bob's secrets were the same. If so, it returns NO_ERROR. If the secrets differ, an INV_VALUE error is returned instead.
        Throws:
        OTRException

      • step5

        public static void step5(ca.uwaterloo.crysp.otr.SMState astate,
         byte[] input,
         Provider prov)
                  throws OTRException
        Receives the final SMP message, which was generated in otrl_sm_step. This method checks if Alice and Bob's secrets were the same. If so, it returns NO_ERROR. If the secrets differ, an INV_VALUE error is returned instead.
        Throws:
        OTRException
